image.altText: A woman of Asian background with long hair standing out the front of an HSBC bank branch

props.synopsis: Australians are continuing to lose their life savings to a long-running "spoofing" scam targeting customers of banking giant HSBC.

title.children: 'Oh my God, another one': A long-running text scam is still costing Australians their life savings

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie image, for use as thumbnail only.

props.synopsis: Jacqui Lambie Network candidates have a real chance of winning multiple seats in the Tasmanian election and being in the balance of power. So how will they make decisions? And what influence will the senator hold?

title.children: Jacqui clones or on their own? The influence Lambie could wield over her state MPs

image.altText: A man with tattoos wearing a red t-shirt and a baseball cap stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: Hobart man David Coles, who shot and killed escaped prisoner Nicholas Scott in January last year, will spend at least four years in a Tasmanian jail.

title.children: Eight years jail for shooting escaped prisoner 'at close range'

image.altText: Fire glow of a bushfire behnd houses at night.

props.synopsis: As residents in a Launceston suburb prepared to evacuate because of a deliberately-lit bushfire, firebugs were starting more blazes nearby, an investigation reveals — with Tasmania Police urging anyone with information to come forward.

title.children: As people packed their bags to flee one deliberately-lit fire, more fires were being lit nearby, investigators say

image.altText: An orange logo with the word TEMU is seen on the screen of a phone held up by a hand in front of ads on a computer

props.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis has seen Shein and Temu become major players in online retail, but their meteoric rise comes at the expense of local businesses. Is this the end of e-commerce as we know it, or could these brands crash and burn?

title.children: Australians will spend more than $2 billion with Temu and Shein this year — and local retailers are feeling the pinch

image.altText: A man walks past a mural of the MH370 plane flying through a hole made of puzzle pieces.

props.synopsis: Ten years have passed since the disappearance of MH370 and the 239 people on board, but the same question remains: a hulking commercial aircraft can't simply vanish into thin air, can it?

title.children: A Boeing 777 took off and then vanished into thin air. A decade on, the mystery and heartache endures

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: It's the case that has captivated the nation, but despite murder charges being laid over the disappearance of Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy, the missing facts about what happened will keep people asking questions.

title.children: Murder charges over Samantha Murphy's disappearance unlikely to stop the questions

image.altText: A woman and a pixellated face

props.synopsis: A nationwide suppression order over the identity of the 22-year-old man who has been charged with the murder of Samantha Murphy was granted minutes after he was brought to court on Thursday — here's why.

title.children: Here's why the name of Samantha Murphy's alleged killer remains a secret — for now

image.altText: A woman in the middle of ballot boxes pictured from above.

props.synopsis: There are calls for change to the way Indonesia conducts elections after 115 staff died during and in the days after the country's national poll last month.

title.children: More than 100 officials died after the world's biggest single-day election in Indonesia

image.altText: A close up of a young man looking pensively into the distance

props.synopsis: Facebook profited from the decline of Australia's news organisations, but enforcing the News Media Bargaining Code will make a bad situation worse without solving the problem of who will pay for the news.

title.children: Facebook ate and then ignored the news industry. It's hard, but we should leave it be

image.altText: A wide shot of people sitting outsidte with some of their belongings, in front of destroyed buildings in the Gaza Strip

props.synopsis: The US, Egypt and Qatar are trying to broker an agreement for a six-week ceasefire and the release of 40 hostages held in Gaza, in exchange for Palestinians imprisoned in Israel.

title.children: Hamas says ceasefire talks to resume next week, making a truce before Ramadan highly unlikely

image.altText: Malaysia's opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim smiles and gestures as he leaves a press conference.

props.synopsis: Anwar Ibrahim reveals he took up the issue directly with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese during a bilateral meeting ahead of this week's ASEAN-Australia summit in Melbourne.

title.children: Malaysian PM urges Australia to restore UNRWA funding for Gaza

image.altText: Jack Fitzgibbon smiling at camera next to Joel Fitzgibbon

props.synopsis: Lance Corporal Jack Fitzgibbon, the son of former defence minister Joel Fitzgibbon, dies after being injured in a parachuting incident at the Richmond RAAF base on Wednesday night.

title.children: Son of former defence minister dies after parachute incident at Sydney RAAF base

image.altText: A woman holds a child with medical equipment taped to its head

props.synopsis: A $11 million program in Western Australia to give free immunisations to babies against RSV is tipped to stop hundreds of hospitalisations. Here's what experts say needs to happen now.

title.children: As RSV cases rise, experts say vaccines should be free for babies. Here's what your state has planned

image.altText: A shorter Asian man in a suits shakes hands with a smiling Anthony Albanese on a stage

props.synopsis: Australia and Vietnam have signed a memorandum of understanding on energy and mineral cooperation that strengthens ties between the two nations, as the once war-torn country continues to practise "bamboo diplomacy".

title.children: 'The most popular kid in class': Vietnam pens deal with Australia after being courted by US and China

image.altText: A close shot of Dutton speaking from the Prime Minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: As the Liberals recover from their loss in the Dunkley by-election with a frontbench reshuffle, the lack of women in their ranks flags problems to come, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Everyone gets a prize in Peter Dutton's reshuffle but there's an omission he has no solution for

image.altText: Katy Gallagher press club

props.synopsis: The government has announced plans to pay superannuation to those on paid parental leave. Here's how it would work, and how it would affect parents.

title.children: How much could parents benefit from super on parental leave?

image.altText: Two air hostess lie next to a dog wearing a pilot costume.

props.synopsis: The announcement that Virgin Australia will soon be letting small animals onto flights has some pet owners excited to bring their furry friends on holidays, and others concerned about health matters. Here are five quick questions answered.

title.children: Virgin plans to welcome small cats and dogs into flight cabins, but what happens if you have an allergy?

image.altText: Composite image of a dam showing animals near it and a low water line a year later.

props.synopsis: Where once the popular image of Tasmania was rolling green hills, these days drought conditions have left many of those hills brown and dusty.

title.children: Is Tasmania in drought? This is the difference a bad year makes

image.altText: Two children sitting barefoot on a brick driveway

props.synopsis: WA Police rubbish social media video claiming to show damage at the Broome house where three young children were found cable-tied.

title.children: Police rubbish video claiming vandalism at Broome home where kids were found cable-tied

image.altText: Will Hayward pumps his fist and yells in delight

props.synopsis: Sydney beat Melbourne by 22 points in the AFL's season opener at the SCG, with former Demon Brodie Grundy starring in the ruck for the Swans.

title.children: Grundy shines in Sydney debut as Swans steam home to beat Demons in season opener

image.altText: The referee signals 10 to send Canberra Raiders' Hudson Young to the sin bin in an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Canberra's Hudson Young ends the Raiders' 28-12 win over the Knights with a try, but he will nervously await the NRL's charges after a late, high shot on Kalyn Ponga.

title.children: Fiery Raider sin-binned for 'moment of madness' in Canberra's NRL season-opening win over Newcastle

image.altText: A medium shot of an elderly man in sanglasses, a suit and tie walking across a street in New York.

props.synopsis: Eagles drummer and co-founder Don Henley now plans to turn to the civil courts, his lawyer says.

title.children: Charges dropped midtrial in Hotel California lyrics case, but Don Henley vows to fight on

image.altText: An aerial drone shot of a facility being built in the WA outback, with lots of red dirt surrounding.

props.synopsis: As the first antenna is installed on the world's largest radio telescope in outback Western Australia, traditional elders say the $3 billion project brings hope for more opportunities in the desert region.

title.children: As first antenna is installed on groundbreaking 'time machine' telescope, traditional owners welcome project

image.altText: Four men lean against the front of a van in a field

props.synopsis: A Palestinian band, which had their invitation to WOMADelaide rescinded, say they find the reasoning behind it "deeply problematic" and "disheartening".

title.children: Palestinian band 47Soul reacts after left out of WOMADelaide by organisers

image.altText: A group of Australian athletes stand in Olympic uniforms with Sydney Harbour and the Harbour Bridge behind them.

props.synopsis: Indigenous artwork is taking pride of place on Australia's uniforms for the Olympic Games in Paris starting in late July.

title.children: Indigenous print with a nod to Japan. Australia unveils its Olympic uniforms

image.altText: Spencer Leniu points to the sky during Sydney Rooster-Brisbane Broncos NRL match in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: Sydney Roosters forward Spencer Leniu is facing a lengthy suspension following his admission he made a racist remark towards Brisbane Broncos five-eighth Ezra Mam during last Sunday's NRL match in Las Vegas.

title.children: Leniu apologises to Mam after admitting to racist slur

image.altText: An elderly woman with short, white hair.

props.synopsis: The 95-year-old died in hospital in May 2023 after falling and hitting her head following an alleged incident with a police officer.

title.children: Family of Clare Nowland resolves civil suit against NSW over alleged taser death

image.altText: Robbie Katter holds a "condemn Hamas" sign at pro-Palestine protest in front of Queensland Parliament.

props.synopsis: Two Katter Australian Party MPs have been referred to Queensland's Ethics Committee after clashing with pro-Palestinian protesters this morning.

title.children: 'Condemn Hamas': MPs' fiery clash with pro-Palestinian protesters outside parliament

image.altText: A composite of Lawler in a red jacket in Parliament, and Potter in a shirt standing outside

props.synopsis: NT Police Minister Brent Potter is under pressure over now-deleted Facebook posts he shared on his profile, which included homophobic and racial slurs and misogynistic language.

title.children: 'He was an idiot': NT chief minister backs police minister after racist Facebook posts

image.altText: Rust movie armourer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed.

props.synopsis: A New Mexico jury finds Rust armourer Hannah Gutierrez guilty of involuntary manslaughter, ending a trial over Hollywood's first on-set fatal shooting in nearly 30 years.

title.children: Jury finds armourer guilty of involuntary manslaughter in fatal shooting on set of Alec Baldwin movie Rust

image.altText: Close up of a crocodile's eye

props.synopsis: Wildlife experts explain possible reasons a 3-metre crocodile lurking in a popular creek didn't strike out at a family playing frighteningly close as a search discovers more crocs nearby.

title.children: A family came within metres of a crocodile in a swimming hole. So why didn't it attack?
